column4: hello! correct me if I'm wrong, but I think that if you choose "recovery mode" from grub (default installation) you get a # terminal without any password inquiry whatsoever. Isn't that a security issue?
letting anyone have physical access to your machine is a security issue, there are many other ways in besides recovery mode
bios password with the case locked in a vault.
I have my bios to boot only from the hard drive, with a bios password so they can't boot with a cd or usb. If they steal it, they can take out the screws, I guess
